Class Project1

java.lang.Object
Project1
public class Project1 extends Object
A console project with Java showcasing programming fundamentals through an interactive menu system. The project includes multiple school levels with unique features implemented with structured programming and recursions.

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      A new int[] array containing all prime numbers found up to and including the maximum value n, sorted in ascending order.

      Returns:

    • firstK

      public static String firstK(int[] arr, int k)
      Build a short string representation showing the first k elements of an integer array.

      Used for compact display: prints "[a, b, c]" when length ≤ k, otherwise prints "[a, b, c, ...]". Returns "[]" for null or empty arrays.

      Parameters:
      arr - the array to inspect (could be null)
      k - maximum number of elements to include from the start
      Returns:
      a compact string representing the first up to k elements of arr

    • lastK

      public static String lastK(int[] arr, int k)
      Build a short string representation showing the last k elements of an integer array.

      Used for compact display: prints "[..., x, y]" when array is longer than k. Returns "[]" for null or empty arrays.

      Parameters:
      arr - the array to inspect (could be null)
      k - maximum number of elements to include from the end
      Returns:
      a compact string representing the last up to k elements of arr

    • fmtMs

      public static String fmtMs(double ms)
      Format a millisecond duration to a string with three decimal places.
      Parameters:
      ms - duration in milliseconds
      Returns:
      formatted string like "12.345"

    • primeNumbers

      public static void primeNumbers()
      Interactive console routine to: - prompt the user for an integer n >= 12, - run the three sieve algorithms (Eratosthenes, Sundaram, Atkin), - measure runtime of each in milliseconds, - and print a compact comparative summary.

      Uses SC (a Scanner) to read console input and writes results to standard output. The method loops until a valid integer >= 12 is entered. Side effects: reads from input, prints to output, and measures system time with System.nanoTime().

      See Also:
      • eratosthenesFormula(int)
      • sieveSundaramArray(int)
      • sieveAtkinArray(int)

    • evalExpression

      public static void evalExpression()
      Interactive, step-by-step evaluator for arithmetic expressions.

      Prompts the user to enter an expression consisting of integers, parentheses, and operators +, -, x (or X, *), and : (or /). The method validates input, normalizes operator synonyms, then repeatedly simplifies the expression one step at a time printing each intermediate form until a final value is reached.

      Unary minus is supported. Leading '+' is considered invalid per spec. Uses helper routines for validation, tokenization and evaluation. Side effects: reads from input via SC and prints steps.

      See Also:
      • isValidExpression(String)
      • normalizeOperators(String)
      • simplifyOnce(String)

    • normalizeOperators

      public static String normalizeOperators(String s)
      Replace common operator synonyms with canonical internal symbols.

      Specifically:

      • '×', '*', and 'X' -> 'x' (multiplication)
      • '/' -> ':' (division)
      Parameters:
      s - the input expression string (may contain various operator glyphs)
      Returns:
      a new string where operator synonyms are normalized to internal tokens

    • isValidExpression

      public static boolean isValidExpression(String s)
      Validate the syntax of an arithmetic expression according to the project rules.

      Checks allowed characters (digits, whitespace, +, -, x/X/*, :/ /, parentheses), balanced parentheses, proper placement of operators, and unary minus rules. Leading '+' and illegal operator sequences are rejected.

      Parameters:
      s - the expression string to validate
      Returns:
      true if s is considered a valid expression; false otherwise

    • tokenize

      public static List<String> tokenize(String expr)
      Convert an expression string into a list of canonical tokens.

      Output tokens are:

      • signed integer literals like "-123" or "456"
      • operator tokens: "+", "-", "x" (multiplication), ":" (division)
      • parentheses "(" and ")"

      Unary minus immediately preceding a number produces a single signed-number token; a unary minus before a parenthesis is emitted as a separate "-" token.

      Parameters:
      expr - the input expression string (operator synonyms will be normalized)
      Returns:
      ordered list of token strings suitable for evaluation routines

    • simplifyOnce

      public static String simplifyOnce(String expr)
      Perform a single simplification step on an arithmetic expression string.

      The method:

      1. reduces the innermost parenthesised subexpression to a single numeric token (evaluating it completely), or
      2. performs the leftmost multiplication/division, or
      3. performs the leftmost addition/subtraction
      If no simplification is possible the original expression is returned.

      Tokenization and helper evaluation methods are used internally.

      Parameters:
      expr - the current expression string
      Returns:
      a new expression string with one step simplified, or the original expr if nothing could be simplified
      Throws:
      ArithmeticException - if a division by zero occurs while computing a step

    • evaluateTokensFully

      public static String evaluateTokensFully(List<String> tokensIn)
      Evaluate a token list fully and return a single numeric token string.

      This performs:

      1. resolution of any parenthesis (recursively),
      2. multiplication/division left-to-right,
      3. addition/subtraction left-to-right.

      All arithmetic is integer arithmetic using long; division is integer division. The returned string represents the final integer value (could be negative).

      Parameters:
      tokensIn - list of tokens representing a (sub)expression without external context
      Returns:
      the single numeric string representing the evaluated value
      Throws:
      ArithmeticException - if division by zero occurs
      NumberFormatException - if an integer token cannot be parsed as long

    • computeBinary

      public static String computeBinary(String lhsStr, String op, String rhsStr)
      Compute a binary operation between two numeric string tokens using integer arithmetic.

      Supported operators:

      • "x" -> multiplication
      • ":" -> integer division (throws ArithmeticException on divide by zero)
      • "+" -> addition
      • "-" -> subtraction
      Parameters:
      lhsStr - left-hand side numeric token (could be signed)
      op - operator token ("x", ":", "+", or "-")
      rhsStr - right-hand side numeric token (could be signed)
      Returns:
      numeric result as a string
      Throws:
      ArithmeticException - for division by zero
      NumberFormatException - if inputs are not valid integers

    • parseLongSafe

      public static long parseLongSafe(String s)
      Parse a string into a long, trimming whitespace and treating an empty string as zero.
      Parameters:
      s - string containing an integer (possibly with leading/trailing spaces)
      Returns:
      parsed long value
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - if s (after trim) is not a valid integer

    • joinTokens

      public static String joinTokens(List<String> tokens)
      Join tokens into a single expression string with single-space separators.

      This helper is used to reconstruct expressions after token-level modifications.

      Parameters:
      tokens - list of token strings
      Returns:
      single string expression with tokens separated by one space

    • normalizeSpacing

      public static String normalizeSpacing(String expr)
      Produce a nicely spaced string representation of an expression.

      Tokenizes the expression and joins tokens with single spaces to normalize inconsistent spacing around operators and parentheses.

      Parameters:
      expr - input expression (possibly with irregular spacing)
      Returns:
      expression string with normalized spacing (single spaces between tokens)

    • gameLoop

      public static void gameLoop(int rows, int cols, String gameMode)
      The main game loop for Connect Four
      Parameters:
      rows - The number of rows in the board
      cols - The number of columns in the board
      gameMode - 1 for single-player, 2 for two-player

    • initializeBoard

      public static char[][] initializeBoard(int rows, int cols)
      Creates a new Connect Four board filled with empty slots.
      Parameters:
      rows - Number of rows
      cols - Number of columns
      Returns:
      The initialized 2D char array

    • printBoard

      public static void printBoard(char[][] board)
      Prints the Connect Four board to the console.
      Parameters:
      board - The current game board

    • getPlayerMove

      public static int getPlayerMove(char[][] board, char player)
      Gets a valid column move from a human player
      Parameters:
      board - The current game board
      player - A character value representing the player
      Returns:
      The 0-based column index, or -1 as the sentinel value if the player quits

    • getComputerMove

      public static int getComputerMove(char[][] board)
      Gets a valid random column move for the computer
      Parameters:
      board - The current game board
      Returns:
      The 0-based column index

    • isAllowed

      public static boolean isAllowed(char[][] board, int col)
      Checks if a move is valid (i.e., the column is not full).
      Parameters:
      board - The current game board
      col - The 0-based column index
      Returns:
      true if the column is not full, false otherwise

    • insertMark

      public static void insertMark(char[][] board, int col, char playerMark)
      Inserts a mark into the specified column.
      Parameters:
      board - The game board (will be modified)
      col - The 0-based column index
      playerMark - A char value representing player's mark

    • checkWin

      public static boolean checkWin(char[][] board, char playerMark)
      Checks the entire board for a 4-in-a-row win for the specified player.
      Parameters:
      board - The current game board
      playerMark - A char value representing the player's mark to check for
      Returns:
      true if a win is found, false otherwise

    • isBoardFull

      public static boolean isBoardFull(char[][] board)
      Checks if the board is completely full (a draw condition).
      Parameters:
      board - The current game board
      Returns:
      true if the board is full, false otherwise

    • clearScreen

      public static void clearScreen()
      Clears the screen.

    • waitMillis

      public static void waitMillis(long periodMillis)
      Waits for a specified amount of time.
      Parameters:
      periodMillis - A variable to specify the time in milliseconds that program will wait whenever the method is called.

    • waitBeforeProceed

      public static void waitBeforeProceed()
      Prompts the user for a keystroke "ENTER" to proceed so that they will have the time to stop before moving on whatever's next after something's done.
